comment: Super easy class. This professor made the KSU Online class very easy to navigate and know when things are due. Most of the work is just discussion threads, theres one paper, a midterm, and a final. Nothing proctored, and he was a very nice and responsive professor. You can also work ahead as much as you want! 100% recommend if you need the credit.

Very easy class. The class is 26 discussion posts, a paper, a 2 unproctored exams. The syllabus has a template for the discussions. You are only graded on the template. For some reason the other 30 people in my class missed that. You can easily answer the discussions and take the exam without ever watching a lecture or reading the text book.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: Clear, straightforward teacher. Lectures and hw were always an appropriate length. Coursework was very light and fair. Free pdf of textbook available online. Some questions on tests were ambiguous/wrong, but he threw them out after students emailed him, so be sure to watch for that. Content challenging but good; reasonable teacher.

Not a lot of assignments.  His lectures on MP3 so no video. There is one big paper he tells you about in the syllabus and you have to remember because he doesn't remind you when it gets close which is 3 months later.

I liked this class for the following reasons: The workload is manageable. Lectures are clear and easily understandable. There is wide range of content spanning a massive time period but it's broken up in a way you can follow easily. The test was not easy, but I am halfway through the semester with an A. Keep in mind there is a lot of reading!

Took him online for PHIL2500. Hes very chill teacher but does take a while to respond. If this class wasnt so hard I would recommend him, but believe me when I say this is a very tough course. Its basically a math course so I recommend taking it in classroom setting, where you can get more guidance. You wont get that online with Johnson.

If you show him that you sincerely care, he'll help you get an A. There is a lot to read, and the tests are kind of hard. BUT!!! By replying to other people, writing meaningful threads, you will do well. He let me rewrite my analysis paper and I got a 93, from a 78. He rounded my final grade from an 87.6 to an A, congratulating my effort.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: In terms of papers there's only 1 essay, but there are 1-3 discussion board posts each week. SO MUCH READING (there's not really a set textbook, though). His lectures are interesting and he really knows what he's talking about, but this course is very intensive, so if you're taking this as an "easy" elective for gen. ed.--take something else.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Professor Johnson was a good teacher. His online class was very easy but the tests were not easy. If you don't listen to his lectures or do the practice quizzes, you most likely will fail them. The discussion posts are very easy and grades them by each month. His lectures are very interesting.

Likes to hear himself talk. 6 total grades (midterm, 3 discussion post grades, analysis paper, final). Multiple choice/true-false test questions EXTREMELY ambiguous. Ended with a 79 in the class, emailed him explaining that I BUSTED MY BUTT and was hoping for a B. He didn't respond... at least say no or just respond, that's incredibly rude to me.
Very thought provoking course. Definitely take if you have the opportunity. Professor Johnson is fantastic.

The material in the class is confusing but the grading requirements are pretty straight forward. Discussion posts every week, midterm and a final. But beware the the professor does not post grades until the end of the semester so you have no idea what your grade is until final grades are posted.

Great course. Tons of interesting, thought provoking reading. Excellent online lectures. 2 tests (based on ungraded self-tests, lectures, and power points), weekly discussion posts, and a philosophical analysis (paper) on a philosopher's essay/aphorism of your choosing. Excellent and extremely knowledgeable professor. Would take this course again.

Took it online. 2 discussions every week, lectures, and read  galore. I didn't read. Just kind of went off other people's posts. Only had 4 grades: discussion, midterm, final, paper. Pretty easy but more time consuming than you would think. Hated it but got through it.
Best class ever. I made a 98 and Im no genius. Just do everything you're supposed to.  I actually learned a lot also.

Took class online.  I was initially concerned with the small number of grades in the class; 2 tests, 2 discussion grades (1st and 2nd half of semester), and 2 papers.  However, participate in discussions and put reasonable effort into papers and the tests aren't overwhelming.  Be sure to study non-required quizes for the tests!

Taking online class, now.  Very easy.  But you do have to put forth an effort and keep up with the work. Professor Johnson is very kind, laidback, and willing to help out. He returns emails quickly and is willing to work with you on grades and due dates -- if you reach out to him. Snag this course if you can!

I thought this class was very easy and Dr. Johnson was very helpful.  The discussions are easy to get full credit on as long as you keep up with them. He is very nice and accessible for an online class and understands that you have outside priorities. I definitely recommend his class. Lots of books though.

I took the Hybrid class as well and it wasn't easy, I worked hard for my grade but overall enjoyed the class. Slackers shouldn't take him, he expects you to put forth an effort but will help you every step of the way. I would take him again!

Professor Johnson is very passionate about the subject! However, his lectures were very confusing and he would go off on tangents often. I did not use any of the textbooks and I made an A. I took the hybrid course and there are only a few grades: 2 tests, discussion posts, and an essay. The class is very easy if you keep up with the work!

Don't take this class online.  Only 4 grades.  The two tests include true/false questions, how ridiculous is that?  The true/false questions are completely unclear, it's impossible to answer some because the question can have multiple answers.  Lectures are boring.  Pass on this one.

Took Hybrid in fall. Very unclear on expectations. 20% discussions, 20% paper1, 25% paper2, 25% short answer final, 10% attendance. Go to class and do discussions for easy points. If you really try he will do his best to help you. Also, you can submit papers early and he will give you feedback before you turn it in.

Took Fall online. Class makes you think and is interesting. Grade was 25% discussion, 25% Paper 1, 25% Paper 2, 25% Final short ans test. Prof is a GHOST-you do not know if you are passing or failing. Lots of work but easy A if you do the work. I would say 2 hours per week discussions, then just the two papers.

Very passionate.  He will tell you if your comments on the discussions boards or in class are off track and then help you understand.  I wrote two papers and took a final.  Got an A.  Discussion boards weekly are easy points, as well as attendance.  Great gen ed course to pair with more difficult courses
great teacher, very friendly

Good teacher - but doesn't answer emails enough - which is very imortant since class meets only once a week. He makes the discussion interesting - but forget about the books - no need to purchase them as everything can be found online!
Extremely Passionate- just boring and difficult to understand.

Very good teacher.  He's really passionate about what he does so that makes the class pretty interesting.  There's only one test and one paper throughout the semester so just attend class and do well on the other two and you'll get a good grade! but he's great, i definitely recommend his class
